content.question: The major goal of the Social Gospel movement in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries was to

choices.label: encourage support for Charles Darwinâ€™s theory of biological evolution
draw the attention of Protestant churches to the plight of the urban poor
send missionaries to convert American Indians to Protestantism
promote the spread of Protestantism in United States territorial possessions
stimulate public interest in the principles of Anglo-Saxon superiority

content.answer: draw the attention of Protestant churches to the plight of the urban poor

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
